content: My cousin got a rescue cat, sweet docile little kitty. In an hour she had challenged and beat up the big dog, tackled the little dog, took over the comfy spot on the couch. At the moment the dogs are worshipping and obeying the queen. LOL. I thought cats were scared of dogs.

title: Who knew a cat could take over the house.

content: Lends credence to the two phrases: "Dogs have Masters, Cats have Servants", and "Dogs Drool, Cats Rule". From experience...I have two 11 1/2 y/o brothers...litter mates...

title: Who knew a cat could take over the house.

content: When I was a kid, I had a Tabby cat that was quite attached to me. I was digging up a septic field for my next door neighbor just a shoveling away mindlessly when I heard this low throated growl; I looked up to see a different neighbor's German Shepard staring me down from about 15' away dragging it's chain! I'm contemplating beating it to death with my spade when I hear a different sort of yowl from behind me and there's my Tabby, hackles up, fangs bared, and fully hunched! That Junk-yard dog sauntered over toward my Cat and I thought that now I will have to kill this dog to protect my Cat. The Dog got almost to the Cat and she reared up and did several quick rakes of her claws across his snout almost to fast to follow. All I heard was a yelp and that Dog took off like a shot for home with my cat chasing it all the way! I ended up having to save that dog from my cat! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine

content: Any person who thinks that they have the upper hand on a cat should first try brushing their teeth with a chain saw.

content: quote: Originally posted by NM11AZ: Any person who thinks that they have the upper hand on a cat should first try brushing their teeth with a chain saw. just got to let them know you are the "the alpha" had a cat who hated to be brushed... well every time it hissed and spit at me it got whacked with the flat end of the brush on it's rear flank.... took a while for that cat to understand that when it was brushing time it WAS going to get brushed.. it learned it was better to submit then get "the brush" and even it's tail too.... it glowered at me usually for the rest of the day but it learned.. the old boy ain't so bad as long as I obey the rules. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: My wife and I gave a young yellow tabby male cat to a friend. A real fraidy cat. We had two females already. The friend's Shi zu chased "Chewie" under the bed and wouldn't let him out. And Chewie was bigger! That went on every day for a week. Well, Chewie's back with us. And much happier! But he's still yellow.

content: I've got this to say to all of you: ............ I've got four cats, three males, one female. And for the most part, as long as they don't get in each others way, things are fine. CATS RULE, DOGS DROOL

content: DOGS HAVE MASTERS; CATS HAVE "STAFF" DOG: "I'm man's BEST friend." CAT: "Friends? I don't need no stinkin' friends!" These are my opinions. Yours may differ.
